featured.text: In 1990, Mitsubishi Electronics was reported to have announced the formation of a team composed entirely of AB workers, thanks to “their ability to make plans.”

They travel entirely along tree branches and as a group when “commuting” between two vines, laying down trails of pheromone (a locations, such as from their nesting site to their chemical substance) behind them so that other feeding ground.
None of them, however, has been proven to be entirely true.
The Maasai are a semi-nomadic group in Kenya and northern Tanzania, wandering in bands and living almost entirely on the meat, blood, and milk of their herds.

definition.en_def: Completely; fully; without any part left out.
definition.example: She was entirely satisfied with the results.
